summary: The UK government is actively engaging with stakeholders on AI regulation following the closure of a formal consultation period on June 21, 2023. The National AI Strategy emphasizes a pro-innovation approach to governing AI, with a white paper outlining proposals for a balanced regulatory framework. This framework aims to foster an environment conducive to AI development, driving growth and public trust while positioning the UK as a global leader in AI technologies. The government recognizes AI as a critical technology within its broader Science and Technology Framework, which seeks to establish the UK as a science and technology superpower by 2030.
takeaways: The formal consultation on AI regulation closed on June 21, 2023, but stakeholder engagement continues.
The UK government aims to develop a pro-innovation regulatory framework for AI.
AI is identified as one of five critical technologies in the UK's Science and Technology Framework.
The new regulatory approach is intended to boost innovation, investment, and public trust in AI.
The government seeks to strengthen the UK's position as a global leader in AI development.
